poem:
**Portrait in Repose**

In the quiet snap  
of shuttered light,  
she dreams roses,  
their petal whispers  
framing  
her final stage—  
  
Candy,  
velvet in her stillness,  
a graceful play  
of parting—  
eyes open  
only to the dark,  
where echoes  
meet their soft  
refrain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Peter Hujar: Eyes Open in the Dark review – visions of a vanished world To date, the American photographer Peter Hujar’s most well-known shot is his beautiful and melancholy portrait of Warhol “superstar” Candy Darling in repose on her deathbed. She is surrounded by flowers, a single rose lying by her side. Made in 1973 at her request, it is an artfully staged collaboration with, as Hujar later put it, “Candy playing every death scene". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
